channel.title: My halo 3 is slightly zoomed in
channel.description:
I've been googling this for a while and no one seems to know the fix. Hopefully someone here has faced this issue.
I recently started playing halo 3 again and the gameplay is slightly zoomed in. The menus and stuff are fine, it's just when i'm in a game. I can't see all my weapon like normal and I really noticed a difference when I went on a mongoose and couldn't see it all. I've looked through all the settings and it's fine. All my other xbox games aren't zoomed in. The tv is fine.
Any suggestions?

item.title: My halo 3 is slightly zoomed in
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Never thought it could be disc damage because of how basic it seems. Oh well, not like I play it that much anymore anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: My halo 3 is slightly zoomed in

item.title: My halo 3 is slightly zoomed in
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

sounds like disc damage, my copy of mirrors edge had a weird bug that would crash the system when playing on the hardest difficulty at a certain point in the story, the only solution was to get a new disk.

Read full topic
item.source: My halo 3 is slightly zoomed in

item.title: My halo 3 is slightly zoomed in
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:6, topic:461380”][quote author=vManlyMan link=topic=564314.msg4109219#msg4109219 date=1348360461]
Try changing around the settings on the TV. My moms TV used to have this problem when you would watch DVDs.

[size=2pt]EDIT: If you want to play some Halo 3 together, let me know and I’ll send you my GT. [/size]
[/quote]

The thing is I never touched the settings on the TV and every other game is fine.[/quote]
Possible game disc/data damage?

Read full topic

item.title: My halo 3 is slightly zoomed in
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

Press all the buttons on your controller/joystick or whatever you use. The ‘back’ button may do it.
